result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly Marie Hallio

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kimberly Marie Hallio in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Kimberly Marie Hallio.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/30/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. Victim Restitution - RS
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. Victim Impact Statement - RS

Defendant Kimberly Marie Hallio appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Kimberly Marie Hallio.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kimberly Marie Hallio in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kimberly Marie Hallio appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD:  Court is in jury trial and unable to hear this case.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Parties emailed new court dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with R.W.S. (8/12/1965).
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kimberly Marie Hallio in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 35.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:

Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/27/22 @ 1p
